title: 108_s851
content: The "Child Custody Protection Act" may be cited as the short title. Title 18, United States Code, is amended to include a new chapter on the transportation of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to abortion. The "Child Custody Protection Act" is a new chapter in Title 18, United States Code, that addresses the transportation of minors across state lines for abortions, in violation of parental involvement laws. Offenders face fines or imprisonment for abridging parental rights. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits transporting minors across state lines for abortions without parental consent, except in cases where the minor's life is at risk. Offenders and parents of transported minors are protected from prosecution. An affirmative defense is available if the defendant reasonably believed parental consent was obtained. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits transporting minors across state lines for abortions without parental consent. Parents can seek civil action for harm caused by violations of this law. Definitions for parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision are provided in the Act. The "Child Custody Protection Act" defines key terms related to parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision, including the definition of a parent, minor, and State. The Act prohibits transporting minors across state lines for abortions without parental consent. The "Child Custody Protection Act" amends the table of chapters for part I of title 18, United States Code, by inserting a new item after chapter 117. The "Child Custody Protection Act" adds a new chapter 117A related to transportation of minors in circumvention of abortion laws.
